Is this exactly the same as in ProcessListTableItems ? Can we extract the dropdownitems together with the actions to a separate component/s?
Conceptually in following lines:
Move dropdowns and their actions to a separate file, let's call Actions for now. Resulting would be: Actions.SkipDropdownItem, Actions.onSkipSuccess(), Actions.onSkipFailure(), Actions.RetryDropdownItem ...
then in const dropdownItems below we would be adding return [ <Actions.RetryDropdownItem/>, <Actions.SkipDropdownItem/> ] and the on-functions would be hidden in Actions.
But we would need probably to pass the functions to alter the modal from there ... or would moving the ProcessListModal to the new file help there? to have another component <Actions.ProcessListModal /> ...
I mean at least as a follow-up action ... wdyt?
yeah I had similar idea, it starts to become evident that we would need another component here for the actions.
so do you want me to go with the same PR?

This can be done as a follow up ..
here is the JIRA link for that -> https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2608
can we add check for the result? probably checking if onRetriggerFailure() has been invoked ..... or check contents of the modal?
so now the modalContent is being checked as well

Should all these error messages be getting put into a separate file for i18n and ease of maintenance?
In other places, we say "The node [id] was..." Should we stick with that wording here? I.e. "The node [id] was successfully re-executed." Is it important that it was in an error state? Or that it is now (if it failed wouldn't it be assumed to be now in error?) @cristianonicolai

@srambach I agree we need to review i18n and consolidate these messages. @nmirasch could you open a JIRA for that?
Regarding this message in specific, I agree to make it more consistent so: The node [name] was successfully re-executed. looks good to me.
@cristianonicolai  @srambach  sure, here it is  https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2625
